group_1.textCenter: Before those two recovered from their wounds...
I'd been trying to sneak past Isabeau's@tight surveillance.
I used magic to locate where La Pucelle was@being held captive.

group_1.textRight: We couldn't find Tart's mind.
Even though her body and Soul Gem were there...
That sounds strange.

group_1.textLeft: It wasn't long before I discovered the cause.
The enemy used a trap to imprison her mind,@not body...
La Pucelle had quite literally lost her mind.

group_1.textRight: The "Curse of Purgatory"...

group_1.textLeft: Yes, there's an old grimoire that describes@the process.
However, the spell is so powerful that it's@impossible to cast under normal circumstances...

group_1.textRight: ...Perhaps they used a wish.
Those masked women gather those with@the potential to be Magical Girls...
And force them to use their wish to@create miracles for themselves...

group_1.textLeft: ...Indeed.
I heard of that while I was traveling with Ui.
It's a very powerful spell, but the nature of@the barrier is exactly as the grimoire described.
It won't kill a weakened mind, it keeps it alive@and just locks it away for a long time.
That's what this Purgatory is.

group_1.textRight: Without outside interference, the trapped mind@just continues to sleep.
Therefore, they won't become a Witch@out of despair.
Both mind and body will continue to slumber@as if they were dead...

group_1.textLeft: ...That seems like a very elaborate trap.@What's the enemy's purpose?

group_1.textRight: I don't know, either.
...Perhaps it's related to the declaration at Reims.
"Death will befall La Pucelle one year from now."
If their objective was to simply kill Tart...
There would be no reason to keep her alive@as a prisoner of war.

group_1.textLeft: ...That's true.
However, thanks to the grimoire, I discovered@a way to break the spell.

group_1.textRight: Indeed.
One can enter Purgatory through dreams.
Through that method...
We can recover Tart's mind.
For that to happen, Perenelle, as the castor@of the spell...
...would have to enter the barrier herself.

group_1.textLeft: But this is a dream-like world... I wouldn't@be able to remember properly.
That's why I brought in a way to communicate@with Qube on the outside.
That's what the stone is for...
...Huh? In that case...
How come Sakurako and I are here?

group_1.textRight: Hm... Who are you?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, did you forget my voice...?

group_1.textRight: Rather than forget...
He's been out there this whole time.@He doesn't know who you are.
...We had no memory of our journey together@until we got here.

group_1.textLeft: Oh... Maybe I didn't either?
Some memories will be lost here...and@some will be restored.

group_1.textRight: | ...I can't use telepathy. |
| I have no idea what you're all discussing. |

group_1.textLeft: Oh, that's right! I'm so sorry!
Qube might not even know you're here!
...We need to explain who you two are to Qube.
Moreover, I don't know what sort of being you are,@either.
I'd love to learn more.

group_1.textRight: | ...All right, understood. |
